title: Graph API Organic Posting — Facebook Page & Instagram Feed
description: Implement organic (non-paid) timeline posting to Facebook Pages and Instagram professional accounts using Meta Graph API and Instagram Graph API. Separate from the existing Marketing API (ads) track. Covers image, video, carousel, and Reels posting with a unified dispatcher, post queue, scheduling, retries, token lifecycle management, and a GCP-migration-ready secrets abstraction.

phases.name: MVP — FB Text + IG Image Post
Full Post Type Support + Queue Model

existing_tracks: Meta Marketing API services (metaCampaignService, metaAdSetService, metaCreativeService, metaGovernanceService) — existing Meta app credentials and App ID are reused
emailService.jsw — for token health and dead-letter alerts
airtableClient.jsw — for post queue and audit log collections
infrastructure: GCP Secret Manager (v2 — migration path via gcp_migration_20260218 track)
external_apis: Meta Resumable Upload API — rupload.facebook.com (for Reels/video)

kill_switch: SOCIAL_POSTING_ENABLED flag in configData.js — set to false to immediately disable all organic posting
notes: This track covers ONLY organic (non-paid) posting. Boosting posts is handled by the existing Marketing API services.
Facebook personal profile posting is NOT possible via Graph API by design. This track targets Facebook Pages only.
Instagram Stories are supported by the API (media_type=STORIES) but are NOT in MVP scope.
All token exchange and secret operations MUST run server-side in .jsw files only. Never client-side.
IG media (images) must be JPEG format only per API limitation. PNG and other formats are rejected.
Video/Reels require async polling of the container status_code before publishing — this adds latency.
Page Publishing Authorization (PPA) may be required for the linked FB Page before IG posting works — advise users to complete PPA preemptively.
App Review is required for all permissions before Live Mode — development/testing only works for app role users.
